newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hoechst's Berhing-U.S. approves Dade merger.
newsitem.headline: Hoechst's Berhing-U.S. approves Dade merger.

text.p: Behring Diagnostics, a U.S.-based unit of German chemical group Hoechst said on Friday that it had received approval from U.S. cartel authorities allowing it to merge with Dade International.
"Behring Diagnostics has been granted clearance from the FTC to move forward with the merger of Dade International," Behring said in a statement.

"While we are waiting for comment and, ultimately, approval from the European authorities in Brussels, we will continue to work as two separate companies," Uwe Bicker, chairman and CEO of Behring Diagnostics, said.
"Depending on the length of th regulatory approval review by the European Commission, we are expecting the merger to be completed by late summer or early fall," Bicker said.
Dade reiterated forecasts for the resulting stand-alone company of annual sales of over $1.5 billion with around 8,700 employees.
Hoechst said last week that the Dade Behring joint venture would seek a bourse listing next year once cartel authorities have given their approval to the deal.
